Class LevelScreen

java.lang.Object
pacman.LevelScreen
public class LevelScreen extends Object
Main game screen where the gameplay occurs. Handles game mechanics: - Player movement and animation - Ghost movement - Collision detection - Score tracking - Game state (pause, win, lose)
Author:
Danilo Spera

  • Method Details

    • loadLevel

      public void loadLevel(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, String levelName)
      Loads and initializes a game level. Sets up the game board, player position, ghosts, and starts game loops.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the application
      levelName - Name of the level file to load

    • movePlayer

      private void movePlayer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, char[][] levelData)
      Moves the player character based on current direction.
      Parameters:
      gridPane - The game grid
      levelData - Current level data

    • stopMovementTimeline

      private void stopMovementTimeline()
      Stops all game timelines (movement and animation).

      Shows game over screen with final score and replay options.

      gridPane - The game's visual grid

      Starts Pacman's mouth opening/closing animation.
      Parameters:
      gridPane - The game's visual grid

    • moveGhosts

      private void moveGhosts(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane ghostGridPane)
      Moves all ghosts in random directions. Handles collision detection with walls and player.
      Parameters:
      ghostGridPane - The ghost layer visual grid

    • setReturnToMenuCallback

      public void setReturnToMenuCallback(Runnable callback)
      Sets callback for returning to main menu.
      Parameters:
      callback - Runnable to execute when returning to menu

      Sets movement speed for player and ghosts.
